alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 7:03PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Sierra County through 745 PM MDT... At 703 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Monticello to City of Elephant Butte to 8 miles northwest of Upham. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Truth or Consequences, Engle, Cutter, City of Elephant Butte, Spaceport America, Rock House, North Monticello Point, Alamosa Canyon, Elephant Butte Lake, Lost Canyon, Ash Canyon, Rock Canyon, Hot Springs Landing, Lakeshore Highlands and South Monticello Campground. This includes Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 74 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes
